item.title: 市场动荡推动股票交易创下新高，高盛利润大幅增长
item.description: 由于动荡的市场使股票交易收入创下历史新高，而交易量的回升又促进了投资银行业务的发展，高盛第二季度利润猛增 22%。【原文：Goldman Sachs' profit jumped 22% in the second quarter, as turbulent markets lifted equities trading revenue to a record and a pickup in dealmaking boosted investment banking.】

item.title: 意大利要求邮政和国家造币厂重启 PagoPA 协议谈判
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，意大利希望国家支持的意大利邮政（Poste Italiane）和国家造币厂重启收购 PagoPA 的谈判。【原文：Italy wants state-backed Poste Italiane and the state mint to revive talks to buy PagoPA, the Treasury-owned platform that handles digital payments to the public administration, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 早间竞价关税通胀引发债券危机
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美元贬值是美国跨国公司的福音
item.description: 美国大型跨国公司应该很快就会开始显现出近几个月美元贬值的积极影响，从而扭转过去几年美元走强对拥有大量海外收入的公司造成伤害的局面。【原文：Large U.S. multinationals should soon start showing the positive effects of the dollar's tumble in recent months, reversing the situation in the past few years when the greenback's strength hurt companies with significant foreign revenue.】

item.title: 安联集团基金子公司 AGI 首席执行官表示可恢复在美国的业务
item.description: 德国安联集团首席执行官表示，安联集团的基金管理公司 AGI 在美国爆出欺诈丑闻后被迫退出美国市场，但该公司可以恢复在美国的业务。【原文：Allianz's fund management arm AGI can resume business in the United States after being forced to exit the market following a fraud scandal, the German company's CEO said.】

item.title: 行业主管称美国关税和美元疲软威胁意大利出口
item.description: 意大利商业游说团团长周三表示，由于欧盟已经面临不利的汇率，欧盟对美出口唯一可接受的关税将是零关税。【原文：The only acceptable tariff on European Union exports to the United States would be zero as the bloc is already facing a detrimental exchange rate, the head of Italy's business lobby said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 印度马恒达科技公司第一季度收入略有下降
item.description: 印度科技马恒达公司（Tech Mahindra）周三公布的第一季度收入略低于预期，原因是客户在关税相关的不确定性中紧缩了非必要支出。【原文：India's Tech Mahindra reported a marginally lower-than-expected first-quarter revenue on Wednesday as clients tightened non-essential spending amid tariff-related uncertainty.】

item.title: 市场动荡提振交易员，美国银行利润上升
item.description: 美国银行周三表示，由于交易员在第二季度从动荡的市场中获得了更多收入，该行第二季度利润有所增长。【原文：Bank of America's profit rose in the second quarter as its traders brought in more revenue from tumultuous markets in the second quarter, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 保加利亚获得花旗银行资助扩建科兹洛杜伊核电站
item.description: 保加利亚能源部周三表示，保加利亚已与美国花旗银行（Citi）达成合作，为在科兹洛杜伊核电站（Kozloduy NPP）建设核电机组提供资金，这是该国几十年来最大的能源项目。【原文：Bulgaria has secured a partnership with U.S. bank Citi to finance the construction of nuclear power units at Kozloduy NPP, marking the country's largest energy project in decades, its energy ministry said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧盟发言人称欧盟贸易首脑将在华盛顿举行贸易谈判
item.description: 欧盟发言人告诉路透社，欧盟贸易负责人马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）将于周三前往华盛顿特区参加关税谈判，并将会见美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）和美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）。【原文：EU trade chief Maros Sefcovic will head to Washington D.C. on Wednesday for tariffs talks, an EU spokesperson told Reuters, adding that he will meet U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer.】

item.title: 强生公司利润超出预期，得益于强劲的 Darzalex 和医疗技术产品销售
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）周三公布了第二季度利润报告，并将全年销售预期上调了约 20 亿美元，原因是其抗癌药物 Darzalex 的强劲需求以及医疗设备业务的强劲表现帮助其业绩超出了华尔街的预期。【原文：Johnson & Johnson reported second-quarter profit and raised its full-year sales forecast by around $2 billion on Wednesday as strong demand for its cancer drug, Darzalex, and strength in its medical device business helped it beat Wall Street expectations.】

item.title: 特朗普关税给希腊桃子丰收带来寒意
item.description: 希腊是世界上最大的桃子罐头出口国，其中约五分之一销往美国。桃子已经被美国征收 17% 的进口税。新关税可能会将进口税总额提高到 47%。【原文：Greece is the world's biggest exporter of tinned peaches, about one-fifth of which goes to the United States. Peaches are already subject to a U.S. import levy of 17%. The new tariffs could increase the total import duty to 47%.】

item.title: 标准普尔500指数和纳斯达克指数期货因利率和关税担忧而下滑
item.description: 由于有迹象表明美国的关税政策正在给企业前景蒙上阴影并刺激通胀，创下历史新高的市场受到影响，周三跟踪标普500指数和纳斯达克指数的期货下跌。【原文：Futures tracking the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq fell on Wednesday as signs that U.S. tariff policies were clouding corporate outlooks and spurring inflation weighed on record-high markets.】

item.title: 减肥支出激增，许多美国雇主计划削减医疗福利
item.description: 咨询公司美世（Mercer）周三发布的一项最新调查显示，由于减肥药和特效药的成本上升挤压了预算，半数以上的美国大型雇主计划明年缩减医疗福利。【原文：More than half of large U.S. employers plan to scale back healthcare benefits next year as rising costs from weight-loss and specialty drugs squeeze budgets, according to a new survey released by consulting firm Mercer on Wednesday.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂如何转变为北美成本最低的油田之一
item.description: 巨型铲车、无人驾驶卡车和一个像狗一样的机器人都帮助加拿大的油砂公司（包括帝国石油公司和Suncor公司）成为北美成本最低的石油生产商之一，即使一代人以来最严重的通货膨胀推高了美国页岩油的成本，这些公司仍然降低了管理费用。【原文：Giant shovels, driverless trucks and a dog-like robot have all helped Canada's oil sands companies including Imperial Oil and Suncor become some of North America's lowest-cost oil producers, driving down overheads even as the worst inflation in a generation pushed U.S. shale costs up.】

item.title: 针对扎克伯格的 80 亿美元诉讼案：Facebook 的隐私保护措施成为焦点
item.description: Meta Platforms 股东起诉马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）及其他现任和前任公司领导人，声称他们违反 2012 年与美国联邦贸易委员会（U.S. Federal Trade Commission）达成的协议，非法获取了 Facebook 用户的数据。【原文：An $8 billion trial by Meta Platforms shareholders against Mark Zuckerberg and other current and former company leaders kicks off on Wednesday over claims that they illegally harvested the data of Facebook users in violation of a 2012 agreement with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission.】

item.title: 聚焦：加密货币巨头 Tether 收购南美一家农业公司的原因
item.description: 全球最大的数字资产公司、加密货币巨头 Tether 正在利用其最近对一家南美农业公司的收购，对每年数万亿美元的全球大宗商品贸易进行战略布局。【原文：Crypto powerhouse Tether, the world's largest digital assets company, is leveraging its recent acquisition of a South American agricultural firm to make a strategic play for the multi-trillion dollar a year global commodities trade.】

item.title: 日本川崎汽船公司首席执行官称，因关税问题，准备将更多船只从美国调离
item.description: 日本航运商川崎汽船（K-Line）首席执行官五十岚竹德（Takenori Igarashi）周三表示，该公司正在调整其在美国的服务，并准备将更多船只改道至其他地区，以应对美国可能提高的关税。【原文：Japanese shipper Kawasaki Kisen (K-Line) is adjusting its U.S. services and is prepared to reroute more ships away to other regions as it braces for potentially higher U.S. tariffs, CEO Takenori Igarashi said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 南非央行行长：特朗普关税使南非 10 万个工作岗位面临风险
item.description: 南非央行行长莱塞特贾-卡尼亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对南非征收关税可能会导致约10万人失业，其中农业和汽车行业受到的冲击最大。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on South Africa could cause around 100,000 job losses, with the agriculture and automotive sectors hardest-hit, central bank governor Lesetja Kganyago said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，澳大利亚即将与中国达成突破性油菜籽协议
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士称，堪培拉即将与中国政府达成协议，允许澳大利亚供应商向中国装运五批试验性油菜籽货物，此举将结束长达数年的贸易冻结。【原文：Canberra is close to an agreement with Beijing that would allow Australian suppliers to ship five trial canola cargoes to China, sources familiar with the matter said, a move towards ending a years-long freeze in the trade.】

item.title: 亚洲债券五个月来首次出现月度外资流出
item.description: 由于对美国关税最后期限的担忧和中东紧张局势的加剧影响了市场情绪，外国投资者在 6 月份五个月来首次从亚洲债券市场撤资。【原文：Foreign investors pulled funds from Asian bonds in June for the first time in five months, as concerns over a U.S. tariff deadline and heightened tensions in the Middle East weighed on sentiment.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国人工智能公司 MiniMax 以保密方式申请在香港上市
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，中国人工智能初创企业MiniMax已秘密申请在香港进行首次公开募股，目标估值超过40亿美元，募股可能在今年年底前完成。【原文：Chinese AI startup MiniMax has filed confidentially for a Hong Kong initial public offering, targeting a valuation of over $4 billion in the float, which could happen before the end of this year, three people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，欧盟反垄断监管机构将调查环球影业的市中心交易
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构将对环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）旗下维珍音乐集团（Virgin Music Group）斥资 7.75 亿美元收购下城音乐公司（Downtown Music）一事展开全面调查。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are set to open a full-scale investigation into Universal Music Group unit Virgin Music Group's $775 million acquisition of Downtown Music because of concerns about its impact on competition, people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚人工智能初创公司获得 AUKUS 自主船舶软件豁免权
item.description: 澳大利亚一家为无船员船只开发软件的人工智能初创公司表示，澳大利亚政府已授予该公司首批 AUKUS 豁免许可证，允许该公司与美国和英国的国防承包商共享信息。【原文：An Australian AI startup developing software for crewless boats said it has been granted one of the first AUKUS exemption licences by the Australian government, allowing it to share information with defence contractors in the U.S. and Britain.】

item.title: 在中国经济韧性的背后，是减薪和副业的生活
item.description: 中国国有企业员工张金明每天晚上下班后和周末送三个小时的外卖，以弥补工资减少 24% 的损失--他希望这样可以避免与同事发生尴尬。【原文：Chinese state firm employee Zhang Jinming makes up for a 24% cut to his salary by delivering food for three hours every night after work and on weekends - and hopes he can avoid awkward encounters with colleagues.】

item.title: ASML 因关税担忧拖累欧洲股市走低
item.description: 周三，欧洲股市下滑，ASML 在发布了疲软的最新业务数据后领跌，而在美国通胀数据强于预期后，投资者对关税引发的通胀的担忧使市场情绪保持谨慎。【原文：European shares slipped on Wednesday, with ASML leading losses after a weak business update, while broader investor sentiment remained cautious on concerns over tariff-driven inflation following stronger-than-expected U.S. inflation data.】

item.title: 雷诺股价暴跌 16%，原因是下调了业绩指导，任命了临时首席执行官
item.description: 雷诺汽车股价在格林尼治标准时间 7 点 19 分下跌了 16%，此前这家法国汽车制造商下调了 2025 年的指导目标，并任命财务总监明托为临时首席执行官。【原文：Shares in Renault were down 16% at 0719 GMT after the French carmaker lowered its 2025 guidance and named finance chief Minto as an interim CEO.】

item.title: 福特因起火风险召回逾69.4万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，由于燃油泄漏问题可能增加起火风险，福特将在美国召回694,271辆汽车。【原文：Ford is recalling 694,271 vehicles in the United States due to a fuel leak issue that could increase the risk of a fire, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Wipro 董事长：美国关税风险下印度 IT 需求前景仍不明朗
item.description: Wipro公司的一位高级管理人员周三表示，由于美国关税风险和全球地缘政治因素，印度价值2830亿美元的IT行业的需求前景仍不明朗。【原文：The demand outlook for India's $283-billion IT sector remains uncertain due to U.S. tariff risks and global geopolitical factors, a senior Wipro executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国和印尼企业在贸易协议前签署协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德宣布与印尼达成贸易协定，华盛顿将把印尼的关税税率从威胁性的 32% 降低到 19%。【原文：U.S. President Donald announced a trade agreement with Indonesia that would see Washington lower its tariff rates to 19% from a threatened 32%.】
